results.title: Family follies
results.creator_credit: Peter J Ketchum and Guidance Associates
results.brief_description: Uses a humorous skit with dances, songs, and production numbers in order to highlight the problems which trouble young people: communication with parents, developing responsibility and independence from parents, and learning to cope with competitive attitudes in the family. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.
results.description: Uses a humorous skit with dances, songs, and production numbers in order to highlight the problems which trouble young people: communication with parents, developing responsibility and independence from parents, and learning to cope with competitive attitudes in the family. results.title: The Human journey: the family
results.creator_credit: Bob Conroy, CTV News and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Examines the evolution of the family as a social unit and discusses the problems resulting from modern families becoming increasingly smaller and more isolated. Suggests communal living, restructured neighbourhoods, and extended families as methods for making family life emotionally more comfortable.

results.title: The Eating on the run film
results.brief_description: Explains the importance of eating well-balanced meals and gives examples of nutritious meals that can be prepared in a minute or two. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: The Common cold
results.creator_credit: Kelly Duncan, Canawest Films and Informedia Productions (US)
results.brief_description: Examines the worth or worthlessness of vaccines, antibiotics, vitamin C and other remedies for the common cold. Emphasises body resistance as the best protection. The structure and function of the virus which causes the cold is explained.

results.title: Clothing. - 3rd ed.
results.creator_credit: Hermann D. Tauchert and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: This film combines animation and live-action to outline the variety and purpose of clothing. The development of fabrics from the early use of grasses, leaves, skins and furs is followed by scenes from early film clips showing industrialisation in textile-making and the manufacturing of synthetic fibres and cloth. Includes footage showing the mass production of jeans (Levi Strauss). Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hermann D. Tauchert and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Body defenses against the outside world
results.brief_description: Describes dangers in the environment and the body’s principal defenses against them; the skin, mucous membrane, bone structure, the five senses and the autonomic nervous system. Includes animated sequences. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: The Art of French cooking
results.creator_credit: Bob Bailey and R&H Media Productions
results.brief_description: A film adaptation of Fernande Garvin’s best selling cookbook. Five famous recipes, using simple ingredients are demonstrated in easy to follow detail. Emphasizes the love and care lavished on ingredients in French cuisine. French toast sandwiches, French onion soup, fish fillets in sauce, beef bourguignon, and cherries jubilee are the featured dishes.

results.title: Animals can bite
results.creator_credit: John Hart, John Hart Films and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Instructs children on how to avoid being bitten by animals encountered on the street and what to do when someone is bitten by any kind of animal. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Discovering color. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Jack Stoops, Paul Burnford and Columbia Broadcasing System
results.brief_description: Discusses differences in color in terms of hue, value, and intensity. Demonstrates techniques of color-mixing and explores the variety of color seen daily in the world around us. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Nutrition: fueling the human machine
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description: Enumerates the facts of nutrition that affect our physical health and well-being. Encourages a balanced and varied diet, discusses the possible dangers of food additives and sugar, and emphasises the importance of exercise to avoid obesity. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
